column4: sorry awc737, my network connection tanked. did more capable people jump on your problem?
not yet
have you determined whether the applications are still installed but maybe not showing up in your menu?
I've noticed that some packages I've installed don't automatically show up in the Xubuntu menus
what would ubu software center be called?
have you tried to invoke it from the cli?
chromium-browser is also listed, although it also disappeared from my main menu
try calling one of the missing applications from the command line and see if it runs
hopefully your menu is just misconfigured somehow
still here
what I dug up is that anything unchecked in tasksell gets uninstalled
even if it's unrelated to what you think you're installing
http://ubuntuforums.org/archive/index.php/t-1585015.html
if you scroll down to slugslug's post: "and then a grep removed /var/log/dpgk showed me what I had to reinstall"
please note I can't determine the probability of success, since I've never dealt with tasksel at all
and I kind of have to leave right now
you're welcome, I hope you get it worked out. I'll be back later on
still with us?
I'm on xubuntu 12.04 right now and I like it so far
sounds like tasksel is an outdated tool
if I recall, I thought there was a lamp meta package via apt?
apparently you are correct. Am I crazy thinking there used to be a convenient lamp meta package in the official repos??
